string_table.name: npxnabnsnfns01001001101
string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: <Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="In this module we are going to learn about the features and benefits of the drugs which is used for flu." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="The flu, short for influenza, is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.It typically affects the nose, throat, and lungs and can cause mild to severe symptoms.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="However, it is curable and can be treated using medications.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Some of them include : Oseltamivir (Tamiflu), Zanamivir (Relenza), Peramivir (Rapivab)." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="It helps to reduce the severity and duration of flu symptoms, including fever, cough, sore throat, and body aches.It helps to reduce the risk of complications from the flu, such as pneumonia, particularly in people who are at high risk of developing complications.It helps to reduce the spread of the flu to other people, particularly in settings such as schools and workplaces." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="In this module we have learnt:
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Definition of Flu.Drugs used in the treatment of flu.Features of the drugs and its benefits." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>
